headline: Why Marry? Oh, Right, That’s Why
abstract: Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.
lead_paragraph: David was washing dishes after supper, his back to me, when we decided to get married. Throughout our 17 years together I had resisted the idea, not wanting to surrender authority to the church or to the state, both of which had opposed our marriage for centuries. Once more, I asked David why he wanted to wed. “Because it would bring me joy,” he replied, and that settled that. — David Jenkins
